title: Bull-rout

content.title: External appearance
content.content: Unlike other similar fish, the bull-rout has three spines on its head. When spawning, males have a reddish belly, whereas females have a reddish-yellow belly with white spots. The fish is 20 - 30 centimetres long.

content.title: Distribution
content.content: Found in the seas of northern Europe.

content.title: Diet
content.content: Eats crustaceans, worms, small fish and juveniles of other fish.

content.title: Development
content.content: Spawns from December to March. It deposits its eggs in clumps on rocks.

content.title: Fishing
content.content: This species is of minor importance to both commercial fishing and anglers.

fact: The male guards the eggs after spawning.
